p: The results of in vitro cytotoxicity of the aqueous and hydromethanolic extracts are presented in Table 1. For hydromethanolic stem barks extracts, the CC50 ranged from 162.33 µg/mL (for M. rubra extract) to 253.33 µg/mL (for M. alba var. alba extract). For hydromethanolic leaves’ extracts, the CC50 ranged, respectively, from 908.20 µg/mL (for M. alba var. rosea extract) to 1051.66 µg/mL (for M. rubra extract). Aqueous stem barks’ extracts had CC50 ranged between 3166.00 µg/mL (for M. alba var. rosea extract) to 4330.33 µg/mL (for M. alba var. alba extract). Finally, leaves’ aqueous extracts of the three studied taxa had the same CC50 values, >5000 µg/mL.
